info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Herkimer County through 630 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Utica, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Frankfort, Jordanville, Elizabethtown, Ingham Mills, Jersalem Hill, West Frankfort, Spinnerville, Corrado Corners, Countryman, North Ilion, Gulph, South Ilion, Kelhi Corners, Davys Corners, Columbia Center and Stewart Corners. People attending Herkimer County Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29A and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding.
